summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) inmate Christopher Santos Felix, conducted on August 16, 2019. Felix provides observations regarding the cell conditions, guard activities, and the discovery of Jeffrey Epstein's death in the MCC on August 10, 2019. He also mentions his cellmate and Epstein's cellmate.

persons.name: Christopher Santos Felix
persons.context: Interviewed by FBI and OIG agents. He was an inmate in the MCC and provides observations about the night of Jeffrey Epstein's death and general conditions.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'JEFF' by Felix. Described as complaining about a CPAP machine. Felix observed his body after his death was discovered.

persons.name: Johnny Contreras
persons.context: Described by Felix as his cellmate who also 'saw everything' regarding Epstein's death but would not speak due to being a member of MS-13.

persons.name: Stone
persons.context: Referred to by Felix as Epstein's cellmate. Was taken to court on the Friday before Epstein's death and did not return that night.

connections.description: Felix was an inmate who observed Epstein's activities and the discovery of his death in the MCC.
Felix stated Contreras was his cellmate in the MCC.
Felix referred to 'STONE' as Epstein's cellmate.

events.title: Discovery of Jeffrey Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. Guards discovered him during breakfast/head count. A male guard entered and performed CPR.

events.title: Epstein's Last Full Day
events.description: Epstein was taken down to legal with his team at approximately 8:00 AM and returned around 8:00 PM. His cellmate 'Stone' was taken to court and did not return that night.

events.title: FBI Interview of Christopher Felix
events.description: FBI and OIG agents interviewed MCC inmate Christopher Santos Felix regarding his observations of Epstein's death and conditions at the MCC.

events.title: Felix Incarceration Date
events.description: Christopher Santos Felix stated he had been in the MCC since March 4, 2019.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Inmate Christopher Felix observed that guards' last security check before Epstein's death was between 12:30 AM and 1:00 AM, and they did not perform proper rounds.
Felix stated that when Epstein's body was discovered, the rope was not over his head, he had earphones in, and he had bruising on his face but no visible marks on his neck.
Felix's cellmate, Johnny Contreras, also allegedly witnessed events but would not speak due to being a member of the MS-13 gang, fearing for his family's safety.
Epstein's cellmate, referred to as 'Stone,' was taken to court on the day before Epstein's death and did not return to the cell that night, leaving Epstein alone.
Felix reported inappropriate behavior between staff counselors and inmates, and issues with contraband at the MCC.
